Package net.minestom.lwjgl.framebuffers

Class GLFWCapableBuffer

java.lang.Object
net.minestom.lwjgl.framebuffers.GLFWCapableBuffer
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLFWFramebuffer, LargeGLFWFramebuffer
public abstract class GLFWCapableBuffer extends Object
Abstract base class for GLFW capable framebuffers.

  • Field Details

    • colors

      protected final byte[] colors
      The colors of the framebuffer.

  • Constructor Details

    • GLFWCapableBuffer

      protected GLFWCapableBuffer(int width, int height)
      This constructur is meant to be used for child classes for super constructor. It is accessible with calling super(width, height).
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the GLFW capable framebuffer
      height - The height of the GLFW capable framebuffer

    • GLFWCapableBuffer

      protected GLFWCapableBuffer(int width, int height, int apiContext, int clientAPI)
      Creates the framebuffer and initializes a new context. This constructor is meant to be used for child classes for super constructor. It is accessible with calling super(width, height, apiContext, clientAPI);
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the framebuffer
      height - The height of the framebuffer
      apiContext - Context constant of package org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW. For example org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW.GLFW_NATIVE_CONTEXT_API
      clientAPI - The client api constant of package org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW. For example org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW.GLFW_OPENGL_API

  • Method Details

    • unbindContextFromThread

      public GLFWCapableBuffer unbindContextFromThread()
      This function unbinds the context, like the OpenGL context, from the Thread.
      Returns:
      GLFWCapableBuffer The framebuffer that has been currently used on this thread ( this )

    • changeRenderingThreadToCurrent

      public void changeRenderingThreadToCurrent()
      This function binds the rendering context to this thread with this framebuffer.

    • setupLoop

      public Task setupLoop(long millis, Runnable rendering)
      This function settes the rendering loop to render on this framebuffer. It will then call in a interval of the input millisecond count the Runnable, with must define the function run that will be callen. Over the return value Task, you can then manage this thread that is managed by the Minestom thread pool.
      Parameters:
      millis - The interval to call the render function in milliseconds
      rendering - The Runnable, whichs run function will be callen for render on on this framebuffer
      Returns:
      Task The Minestom task object to manage the render loop task

    • setupRenderLoop

      @Deprecated public Task setupRenderLoop(long period, TimeUnit unit, Runnable rendering)
      Deprecated.
      Please use setupLoop instead. This method can be used, but the input period will be interpreted as milli seconds.
      Parameters:
      period - Intervall to call the render loop
      unit - The timeunit to interpret the period, will ignore and instead use milliseconds
      rendering - The rendering Runnable to call for render on this framebuffer
      Returns:
      Task The task created by the Minestom thread pool, to manage it

    • render

      public void render(Runnable rendering)
      Starts rendering on the overgiven Runnable. By calling it, it executes the run function of the Runnable to render on this thread, and then swaps all buffers.
      Parameters:
      rendering - The Runnable with the render loop to execute rendering on this framebuffer

    • prepareMapColors

      public void prepareMapColors()
      Called in render after glFlush to read the pixel buffer contents and convert it to map colors. Only call if you do not use render(Runnable) nor setupRenderLoop(long, TimeUnit, Runnable)

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      This function cleans up the native apis. In fact it terminates glfw completely.

    • getGLFWWindow

      public long getGLFWWindow()
      Returns the glfw window used for the framebuffer
      Returns:
      long Id of the glfw window, accessible for the lwjgl GLFW bindings

    • width

      public int width()
      Returns the width of the framebuffer.
      Returns:
      int The framebuffer width

    • height

      public int height()
      Returns the height of the framebuffer.
      Returns:
      int The framebuffer height

    • useMapColors

      public void useMapColors()
      Tells this buffer that the **RED** channel contains the index of the map color to use. This allows for optimizations and fast rendering (because there is no need for a conversion)

    • useRGB

      public void useRGB()
      Opposite to useMapColors()
